pusher_settings.title: Websocket/Pusher Settings
pusher_settings.auth_only: Websocket for Logged in Users Only

help.auto_update: Don't show the yellow update banner, immediately update the discussion list.
help.app_id: Pusher App ID - leave as is if using built-in websocket server.
help.app_key: Pusher App Key - leave as is if using built-in websocket server.
help.secret: Pusher App Secret - leave as is if using built-in websocket server.
help.secure: Force the websocket to use secure protocols - Enable this if you are using a secure websocket server but not website.
help.host: Host of your websocket server - leave as is if the server is the same host as your forum.
help.reverse_proxy: Websockets will connect over port 443 when this is enabled - Use this if you are using a reverse proxy from port 443 to your websocket server.
help.port: Port of your websocket server - leave as is if you don't change the build in server port.
help.cert_path: Only needed if using ssl and NOT reverse proxy. Path to your SSL (https) certificate ON THE SERVER your websocket server is on - usually a .crt or .pem file.
help.pk_path: Only needed if using ssl and NOT reverse proxy. Path to your SSL (https) private key ON THE SERVER your websocket server is on - usually a .key or .pem file.
help.passphrase: Only needed if using ssl and NOT reverse proxy. The passphrase used to encode your certificate - not usually needed.
help.self_signed: Only needed if using ssl and NOT reverse proxy. Enable this if your SSL (https) certificate is self-signed.
help.auth_only: Only allow authenticated users to connect to the websocket server, can reduce the CPU load.
